text:
Your Perfect Day in Chinese Postpartum Confinement
Today was all about slowing things down. While baby and I slept in, my MIL and husband took care of the chores. Xandre started showing signs of cradle cap, so we slathered on some coconut oil, loosened the dead skin with a bit of exfoliation, and Mum gave him a little hair wash. 
Meanwhile, I enjoyed my breakfastâ€”chicken liver, pork slices, and my favorite crunchy black fungus. Lunch was a winner too: chicken herbal soup, steamed fish, and snow peas. Seriously, 10/10! ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼
In addition to my traditional Chinese medicine regimen, I still take the usual postpartum vitamins: fish oil, vitamin C, and a probiotic. @bepurewellness has been my go-to brandâ€”theyâ€™re no-nonsense, and I love that.
After another ginger wash down, I swapped one set of pajamas for another, because letâ€™s be realâ€”Iâ€™m not going anywhere! I had a late afternoon snack of cheekoshein and got ready for my night shift with the little one.
Could you imagine your postpartum journey being this chill?
See you on day 26, so close to FREEDOM DAY!
